note.text: The area that is now Pakistan was home to one of the world's oldest civilizations. The Indus Valley civilization began around 5,000 years ago and lasted for a thousand years. During this time, they domesticated animals, built brick houses, and planned cities along a grid.

Alexander the Great conquered the region in the 300s BCE. In the following centuries, dozens of empires controlled this area, including the Aryans, the Bactrians, the Huns, the Arabs, and the Turks. Each successive conquest left its mark on the culture of the area.
